text: Since i need to connect to a ms-sql database i need to run PHP5, I see new framework dont work 100% with old PHP.
error
Its about 114000 engagements and 30000 contacts that i try to transfer. So its alot of data. Its also files attached to the engagements. Just to paint a picture here.
Hi, does anyone use HubSpot API with react js ?!
<@UR6786GSY>
what are you trying to do?
im trying to retrieve a post by id, but i have some cta in the post_body and i dont know how to render them in the correct way

Hey <@U7ASCEQQK> Sounds like it’s not the SDK here, those errors are general errors with the HubSpot API. FYI the screenshot you posted has your API key in it. Since that allows anyone who has it full access to your account, you’ll want to remove that screenshot and rotate your API key
Gateway timeouts are hard to pinpoint unfortunately.  I’d suggest backing off the number of engagements in each call and space out calls as a temporary fix.
hello, are you trying to do like this exemple ? <https://reactjs.org/docs/integrating-with-other-libraries.html#integrating-with-jquery-chosen-plugin>

You should probably grab the CTA ID and then do an embed with it... You'll need to look up the original CTA so you can figure out how to structure the CTA embeds, then have your app create a cta embed dynamicaly after it parses through the cta stuff
Does the library account for throttling? I wonder if he’s running into HubSpot’s rate limit/throttling issues.
I don’t think that library doesn’t have handle rate limiting.
yeah i think i have to do that because the hubl code is in the html, so i have to parse the html to retrieve the hubl get the id and rebuild the cta... or something similiar
If you give me what it is outputting in your code I can probably parse it out for you pretty quickly
i got this: *{{cta('8b027ff7-9ff0-46b6-9816-134c2e800dce','justifycenter')}}*
do u mean this or the entire html block!? :sweat_smile:
so just create a component with that
and feed it the portal id and the cta id
You will have to grab the portal ID from the api, or just hard code it in your app
and then replace the `###PORTALID###` and `###CTAID###`
your cta id is inside the `cta('')`
the justify center -- that centers a div in there somehow
you might just need to add a text-align center somewhere in that mess
Does that make sense to you?
yes i have to replace the hubl with that  while grabbing the cta id
i think
thx!
